meanings.definition: A system of government that is centralized and dictatorial and requires complete subservience to the state.
meanings.sent1: The totalitarianisms in that country restrict individual freedoms and control all aspects of life.
meanings.sent2: The rise of totalitarianisms in history often led to oppression and fear among the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The strict rules of the totalitarianisms made even choosing what to wear a state matter.
meanings.sent4: Under the shadow of totalitarianisms, the people felt like mere pawns in a grand, oppressive game.
meanings.sent5: The grip of totalitarianisms on society was suffocating, leaving no room for dissent.

meanings.definition: The principles and practices of a totalitarian regime.
meanings.sent1: Studying the totalitarianisms of the past helps us understand the dangers of unchecked power.
meanings.sent2: The totalitarianisms of the regime were evident in its strict censorship and control of information.
meanings.sent3: The absurdity of the totalitarianisms was highlighted when even art was deemed subversive.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of ideas, the totalitarianisms of the regime clashed with the spirit of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The propaganda machine of the totalitarianisms worked tirelessly to maintain control over the narrative.
